entry.tran: (尤指士兵、难民或吉普赛人的)营地
entry.def: An encampment is a group of tents or other shelters in a particular place, especially when they are used by soldiers, refugees, or gypsies.

means.word_mean: 1. a site where people on holiday can pitch a tent
2. temporary living quarters specially built by the army for soldiers;

sentences.sentence: "wherever he went in the camp the men were grumbling"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of encamping and living in tents in a camp
